DOC.brief_summary: This study aims to evaluate the immunogenicity, by means of cell mediated immunity (CMI) and hemagglutination inhibition (HI) assay, and also the safety of a MF59C.1-adjuvanted subunit influenza vaccine compared with a conventional subunit vaccine in previously unvaccinated children aged 6 to <36 months.
DOC.brief_title: Humoral and Cell Mediated Immunity and Safety of MF59C.1-adjuvanted Subunit Influenza Vaccine or a Conventional Subunit Influenza Vaccine in Previously Unvaccinated Healthy Subjects
DOC.criteria: Male and female previously unvaccinated healthy children aged 6 to <36 months. Any known or suspected impairment of the immune system, any serious disease. Any subjects receiving licensed vaccines within 2 weeks (for inactivated vaccines) or 4 weeks (for live vaccines) prior to enrollment in this study. Individuals who have had influenza vaccine or documented suspected influenza disease prior to day 1.
